name: Div. 7
description:
You are given an integer 
    n
. You have to change the minimum number of
digits in it in such a way that the resulting number does not have any leading
zeroes and is divisible by 
    7
. If there are multiple ways to do it, print
any of them. If the given number is already divisible by 
    7
, leave it
unchanged. Input The first line contains one integer 
    t
 (
    1 
    ≤ t
    
    ≤ 990
) — the number of test cases. Then the test cases follow, each
test case consists of one line containing one integer 
    n
 (
    10 
    ≤ n
    
    ≤ 999
). Output For each test case, print one integer without any
leading zeroes — the result of your changes (i. e. the integer that is
divisible by 
    7
 and can be obtained by changing the minimum possible
number of digits in 
    n
). If there are multiple ways to apply changes,
print any resulting number. If the given number is already divisible by

    7
, just print it. Example Input 3 42 23 377 Output 42 28 777 Note In the
first test case of the example, 
    42
 is already divisible by 
    7
, so
there's no need to change it. In the second test case of the example, there
are multiple answers — 
    28
, 
    21
 or 
    63
. In the third test case
of the example, other possible answers are 
    357
, 
    371
 and 
    378
.
Note that you cannot print 
    077
 or 
    77
.
